CHAT.comment: diary for nina29: nina went to see the new house today that she will be moving into at the end of the month. she also went to the park for a while during the afternoon. nina is playing with two porcelain dogs that mrs. wood , our neighbor , just gave to gave to her. she has placed a rubber band in front of them which she pretends is a bone.

u.a: nina points to the two dogs on her floor .
nina points to the rubber band that she is using as a bone .
"teddy bear" mispronounced .
nina points to her teddy bear sitting on the back of a truck .
nina points to the rubber band that she had been using as a bone .
"rubber band" mispronounced .
last four sentences are jumbled and hard to understand . "vitamin" mispronounced .
mother misunderstands nina . she thinks that nina is saying "biting" instead of "vitamin ."
nina has heard her mother talking about whether or not vitamin c was really good for preventing colds .
mother picks up the dogs .
nina had played with gail , a baby-sitter for an hour that afternoon .
mother goes over to nina's doll house .
"want" mispronounced .
mother laughs .
nina picks up a small car and puts it in the bed+room of the doll house .
nina yells .
nina has put a small wooden lady in the car that's in the bed+room .
mother emphasizes "she ."
mother emphasizes "she" .
"spot" mispronounced . nina has heard her mother and a friend talking about white spots in the throat caused by a sore throat .
"spot" mispronounced .
nina had hit her chin against the car door that afternoon as her mother lifted her into the car .
nina points to her chin .
nina pretends to cry .
"to" mispronounced . nina picks up a plastic fork .
last three sentences are jumbled .
linda is nina's mother's younger sister . nina and her mother spent last week-end in santa cruz visiting her . we had gone out one evening for Mexican food .
nina holds her toy fork up to her mother's mouth and pretends to feed her .
nina pretends to eat .
nina starts jabbering nonsense .
nina holds the fork up to her mother's mouth .
mother hands nina one of her toy pots .
"spaghetti" is mispronounced in nina's last two and in her next sentences .
nina continues to mispronounce "spaghetti" for the rest of the tape .
mother takes a toy fork and pretends to twist some spaghetti around it . she then pretends to eat it .
nina is looking for some small wooden people that nina . likes to play with . each one is a different member of the family .
the wooden people fit into the hollows of some small plastic seats .
nina yells . she bends the plastic fork until it breaks .
mother sets a small table down on the floor and puts the hollowed out chairs around it for the wooden people . the table has plates , forks , etc . drawn on the top of it .

a small wooden girl is seated in front of the table . nina puts a toy plate on top of the table . the plate almost covers the top completely . mother wants to find a larger table but nina wants to keep that one .
mother turns a box upside down .
mother points to an empty chair in front of the table .
mother and nina place the various members of the family in the chairs that are set up around the table .
nina starts to say "food" , but doesn't finish the word . she is playing with the plastic fork .
nina points towards the kitchen .
nina whispers as she busys herself arranging the family . mother goes into the kitchen to get some real silverware .
mother hands a fork to nina .
last sentence not pronounced clearly .
nina picks up a plastic cup . she places one of the porcelain dogs near the table .
nina places a plastic cup near the dog .
nina points to the wooden father .
nina busys herself mixing up food and feeding the wooden people and the porcelain dogs .
nina holds a spoon up to an empty seat and pretends to feed the seat .
mother laughs .
nina points to a seat .
nina sticks one of the porcelain dogs in a crib that she finds in the box of her doll house furnishings .
mother places the other porcelain dog on the floor near the wooden family that's sitting around the table .
nina says "side" rather than "beside ." the porcelain dog is near the wooden lady who's sitting at the table .
nina points to the lady .
nina's little friends becky and miriam just got a new kitten that nina loves to play with .

Samantha is the name of the little girl in the family that nina and her mother will be moving in with . nina calls her "Mantha ." this morning nina's mother was working in the garden of the new house and she had put heavy gloves on to pick up pieces of broken glass that were scattered everwhere .
nina loves to look at and gather insects .

nina had taken a very short nap on a mattress in the basement of the new house . we did not have the key to get into the main house . nina was so excited by the new house that she couldn't really settle down . she had come running out to the yard after a few minutes .
nina is referring to the plastic cups that she was playing with earlier .
the neighbors at our new house have horses that nina and Samantha loved . we went over and patted them together .
"them" not pronounced clearly .
"library" mispronounced in last two sentences .
miriam is the name of Samantha's mother and is also the name of Jim's daughter . nina is confused because we met Samantha and miriam and nick (the father of Samantha) at Jim's house .
nonna is the italian word for grandmother .
leila is a three year who goes to nina's baby-sitter with her .
Lijah's the son of some friends of nina's mother .
nina laughs .
nina sticks a fork that she's been holding in her mother's hair .
nina laughs .
there was a life-size train engine at the park for the children to climb on .
nina's two little friends miriam and becky joined us at the park . Samantha's mother was then called "big miriam" and the girl "little miriam ."
nina is sticking the fork in a hole in her pajamas .
nina sticks the fork back in the hole .
nina points to the hole in her pajamas .
nina continues to stick her fork in the hole in her pajamas .
there had been a huge sandbox at the park .
the plastic cups that nina had been playing with are falling off the the small doll house table because they are too big .
nina had placed many different colored wooden blocks of different shapes in the doll house .
last two sentences not pronounced clearly .
mother takes out various pieces of plastic doll house as she utters the last sentences .
nina starts banging her fork .
nina points to a small wooden wagon .
mother points to nina's crib .
maggie , nina's baby-sitter , had let nina take home her son's dump truck for the week-end . nina looks around for the truck . mother finds it .
question is addressed to a wooden lady .
mother starts to build a road for the dump truck out of long flat rectangular blocks .
mother takes out a piece of cardboard .
nina screams because the truck tips over and the wooden lady falls out .
nina stands the wooden people on the side of the road .
nina puts the plastic cups down beside the road .
mother laughs .
nina keeps taking things out of the doll house and piling them beside the road .
mother starts to stack the plastic cups one inside each other . nina protests .
mother laughs .
nina sticks a wooden girl inside one of the plastic cups .
mother points to another spot on nina's floor .
nina turns the cup over and the lady falls out . nina laughs .
nina continues laughing and knocking over cups .
mother laughs .
nina yells .
nina continues laughing .
nina starts jabbering nonsense .
mother takes a tiny baby in a plastic crib out of a paper bag . the baby is covered with a blanket and has a tiny bottle attached to her hand . there is a tiny rattle in her crib also .
nina takes the baby out of the crib .
nina picks up a small pink plastic duck , a rabbit and a tiny truck that all came with the small baby .
nina points to the bottle attached to the baby's wrist .
nina takes out another small baby bottle that she has .
nina alternates between the tiny bottle attached to the baby's wrist and the other small baby bottle .
she means that the rattle is not a bottle .
nina picks up a rattle .
nina yells . she protests because the bottle will not stand upright .
nina sets the small plastic rattle on the floor .
nina trys to remove the mattress from the baby's plastic crib .
mother laughs as nina turns the crib over .

about a month ago Elijah had visited nina for a few days with his brother and his parents . he is three years old nina had trouble at times sharing her toys with him . nina usually called him "Lijah ." however , now she started calling him "elijah ."
nina has taken the nipple off one of the baby bottles .
nina's last sentence jumbled and hard to understand .
mother pretends to pour milk in the baby bottle .
mother points to the rattle , the duck , the rabbit , and the little car that came with the baby .
nina is shaking the baby's rattle .
nina picks up the small duck that also rattles when shaken .
nina watched a children's television program this morning called sesame street . there is a puppet on this program called ernie who is always looking for his rubber ducky .
nina points to the duck in her hand .
nina lays the baby down on the road which we had build out of blocks .
nina starts making shrill sounds as she pushes a tiny car along the road and then places it in the baby's crib .
mother laughs .
the baby is wrapped in a blanket .
nina yells .
mother laughs .
mother laughs .
nina puts the baby in a plastic cup . she puts the duck in another plastic cup .
nina puts the tiny baby's car in a plastic cup .
nina cracks one of the plastic cups .
nina moves the animals , the baby , and the truck from one cup to the next .
nina sticks a porcelain dog in one of the cups .
nina starts jabbering nonsense .
mother holds up the porcelain dog .
nina yells as mother hides the dog behind her on the floor .
nina yells out as she discovers the dog behind her mother .
nina places the dog in one of the plastic cups .
nina puts one of the porcelain dogs in a plastic cup .
sometimes nina takes baths together with her friends becky and miriam .
nina looks at the plastic cup that has cracked .
"plastic" not pronounced clearly .
all the animals are in plastic cups lined up side by side . nina gets up and goes to her bookcase .
nina starts taking everthing out of the plastic cups .
nina protests .
nina picks up a baby bottle .
mother points to the two dogs .
nina giggles as she discovers three little holes on top of one of the porcelain dog's heads . the two porcelain dogs are actually salt and pepper shakers .
nina protests because she has a hard time making the doll's baby bottle stand upright .
mother puts a flat book on the floor for nina to stand the bottle on .
mother takes out the book about babar . there is a picture of his mother swinging him in a hammock .
nina becomes distracted by the tiny plastic car that came with her baby .
nina yells as she pushes the tiny car around the room .
the plastic car is rather delicate . nina starts to pull it apart .
nina keeps fiddling with the tiny car .
mother unwraps a long skinny green hard rubber figure that can be bent and twisted into any kind of shape . we will call it a doll from now on for lack of a better word .
mother laughs as she bends him into a funny position .
mother laughs as nina twists the figure into all sorts of strange contortions .
nina laughs as she continues to twist the green "doll ."
mother laughs .
nina bursts out laughing as she continues twisting the rubber doll .
the sound of a baby crying is coming from a neighboring building .
nina bends the doll's legs into a sitting position .
nina points to the small plastic doll . mother points to the green rubber one .
nina bursts out laughing .
mother is making the rubber doll's legs move back and forth .
mother makes his arm move up and down .
mother laughs .
nina takes the rubber doll and starts bending it .
nina screams out as she continues twisting the green doll .
nina points to a scratch on the green doll's arm .
mother opens a big band-aid .
nina takes the band-aid from her mother and starts to put it on the rubber doll .
mother wraps the band-aid around the rubber doll's arm .
nina makes the doll dance around . then she makes him do the various motions that her mother suggests .
mother laughs as nina twists the rubber doll into all sorts of strange positions .
nina bursts out laughing as she bends the rubber doll in half making his head touch the ground .
nina is taking another band-aid out of the box of band-aids .
nina holds the arm up for her mother to see the scratch .
mother puts another band-aid on the doll .
"his" emphasized by mother .
nina takes another band-aid out of the box .
nina is having trouble getting the band-aids to stick because she doesn't take the paper off .
mother gathers up the discarded band-aid covers and points to the wastebasket .
nina points to the wastebasket .
"wastebasket" mispronounced .
nina points to the leg of the rubber doll .
mother balances the rubber doll on his head .
mother laughs .
nina is gathering up band-aid covers to throw away .
"wastebasket" mispronounced .
"welcome" mispronounced .
nina means that her rubber doll has band-aids on both arms .
nina points to the band-aids on herself .
mother points to the rubber doll .
mother laughs .
last two sentences unclear .
nina makes the rubber doll walk on her mother's leg . then she holds him up close to her mother .
nina gives her mother a big hug .
"fell" mispronounced .
nina puts the rubber doll on her mother's head .
mother takes out the book about babar the elephant .
mother has the book about babar open to a picture many baby elephants playing .
last four sentences unclear .
nina mispronounces "babar ." she says "bar ." this mispronunciation continues for the rest of the tape .
"elephant" mispronounced . nina continues to mispronounce "elephant for the rest of the tape .
there is a monkey standing on his head .
mother turns to a picture of Babar in a clothing store .
last sentence not clear .
nina looks at a picture of Babar in the bath+tub and starts jabbering nonsense .
nina starts playing with the rubber doll again .
nina puts the rubber doll down on the road made out of blocks .
nina puts the rubber doll on her mother's eyes .
mother starts looking at the book about Babar again . she turns to the picture of him doing exercises with the old lady .
mother lies down on the floor and starts to do exercises .
nina lies down on the floor and starts imitating her mother .
nina looks in a small empty box .
mother and nina are looking at a picture in another book .
nina points to the plastic crib of the baby doll .
mother points to a picture of Babar asleep in bed .
nina starts jabbering in the middle of her last sentence .
mother points to Babar in bed .
mother turns to another picture in the Babar book .
we had seen a lot of snail's in miriam and becky's garden .

nina says "'matoes" instead of "tomatoes" during the rest of the tape . she starts to talk about the garden that we are going to have at out new house . we have already started talking about the different vegetables that we are going to grow . nina loves tomatoes .
nina does not finish the last word .
"goody" mispronounced .
nina starts hugging her rubber doll .
nina twists the rubber doll in many shapes .
nina yells out .
